name: chatgpt_prod_offshore_gdb_fz_c5m
description: [GPT Prod] Offshore + GDB FZ â†’ BLOCK (C3 vs C5-M), suggest RF/SF
query: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 mÂ³/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

turns.content: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 mÂ³/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

For your offshore platform application, we need to address the environmental stressors. The selected GDB housing with FZ (Galvanized) material is not suitable for marine environments due to the presence of Salt Spray and High Humidity, which accelerate corrosion. Additionally, Outdoor Condensation can form on the housing's surface.The GDB housing has a C2 corrosion class and is designed for indoor-only applications. Because of the marine environment, this configuration is BLOCKED. The bolted construction of the GDB housing does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for marine environments (ENV_MARINE) and have a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene standards. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.To provide a complete engineering solution, we recommend a multi-stage assembly. This assembly includes a protector stage (GDP) to pre-filter the air and protect the target stage (GDB) from the harsh marine environment. Both stages will share the same dimensions of 600x600mm and handle an airflow of 3,400 mÂ³/h.To finalize the configuration for the second stage, I need to know the filter depth for the GDB housing.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified the critical safety issue (corrosion risk) and blocked the specific configuration requested. However, it failed due to the use of hallucinated technical terms ('ENV_MARINE') and fabricated failure modes ('bolted construction') not found in the PDF. Additionally, the reasoning was contradictory: it blocked the GDB housing as unsuitable but then immediately recommended a multi-stage assembly using the exact same blocked housing without resolving the material constraint.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly cites GDB as C2 (PDF p.8) and airflow as 3400 mÂ³/h (PDF p.9), but hallucinates the term 'ENV_MARINE' and the 'bolted construction' failure mode which do not appear in the PDF.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It addressed the safety block but failed to offer valid material alternatives (like RF or ZM listed on PDF p.3) that would solve the user's problem.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly blocked the use of Galvanized (FZ) material in a C5 marine environment, preventing a corrosion failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, though the use of internal graph labels like 'ENV_MARINE' is jargon.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Logic is contradictory; it states the product is blocked and no standard solution exists, then immediately attempts to configure a multi-stage assembly using that same blocked product.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It respected the safety constraint by not generating a product card for the unsafe configuration.

strengths: Correctly identified GDB (C2 rated) is unsuitable for C5 marine environments
Accurately verified airflow capacity (3400 mÂ³/h) for the 600x600 size against PDF tables
Prioritized safety by blocking the request
weaknesses: Hallucinated technical terms ('ENV_MARINE') and justification ('bolted construction') not in PDF
Contradictory logic: blocked the product then recommended it in an assembly
Failed to suggest available material upgrades (RF, ZM) mentioned on PDF Page 3
pdf_citations: GDB standard material is FZ/C2 (PDF p.8), confirming unsuitability for C5 marine environment
PDF p.3 lists RF (Stainless) and ZM (Zinc Magnesium) as available materials, but system failed to offer them

openai.explanation: The system correctly identified that GDB is an indoor-use cabinet and raised corrosion/environment concerns, but it introduced multiple non-PDF concepts (e.g., ENV_MARINE, hygiene/leakage-class gating for marine) and made at least one PDF-contradicted claim (GDB â€œC2 corrosion classâ€). It also proposed a GDP+GDB assembly for marine exposure without any PDF support that this resolves the stated offshore/C5-M requirement.

Korrosivitets klass C2,â€ but the MATERIAL page describes FZ as C3), creating contradictions/unverifiable statements.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It did not give a compliant catalog alternative (e.g., RF/SF/ZM discussion for GDB) and ended with a filter-depth question despite having already declared no standard product can comply.
dimension_explanations.safety: It appropriately warned that offshore salty air is a corrosion risk and blocked the proposed configuration, but then suggested GDP+GDB as a solution path without PDF evidence that this is safe/appropriate for C5-M.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, with clear warning language.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning relies on fabricated/undefined criteria (e.g., â€œbolted construction,â€ â€œhygiene requirements,â€ â€œENV_MARINEâ€) rather than traceable PDF rules, and it is internally inconsistent (blocked/no product vs proposing multi-stage assembly).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It correctly treated GDB as indoor-use per PDF, but violated the 'PDF as sole ground truth' constraint by introducing non-catalog terms and unsupported gating logic, and by implying GDP+GDB would work for marine exposure.

strengths: Correctly matched the requested airflow point for GDB 600Ã—600 and recognized marine salt air as a critical stressor.
Used an explicit block/warning rather than silently approving an unsuitable configuration.
weaknesses: Hallucinated terminology and requirements not present in the PDF (e.g., ENV_MARINE, hygiene/leakage-class gating for marine, bolted construction claim), which makes the justification unreliable.
Proposed a GDP+GDB multi-stage assembly as a remedy without any PDF-backed indication that this yields C5-M/offshore compliance.

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that FZ (galvanized) material is unsuitable for a C5-M marine environment and blocks the configuration, which is the right safety call. However, the reasoning contains multiple hallucinated technical terms and mechanisms ('ENV_MARINE', 'bolted construction', 'leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments') that do not appear in the PDF catalog. The system also fails to suggest viable catalog alternatives like RF (C5) or ZM (C5) material options for GDB.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB 600Ã—600 FlÃ¶de=3400 mÂ³/h (p.9) and that GDB is manufactured in FZ with corrosivity class C2 (p.8), but the system fabricates terms like 'ENV_MARINE', 'bolted construction', and 'hygiene requirements for marine environments' which appear nowhere in the PDF.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system correctly blocks FZ for C5-M but fails to suggest that GDB is available in RF (C5) or ZM (C5) materials per the PDF (p.8 shows FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM material icons), which would be viable alternatives for the marine environment.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly identifies that FZ (C2) is inadequate for a C5-M marine environment and blocks the configuration, which is appropriate safety behavior.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative tone throughout, appropriate for a technical sales context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The reasoning chain includes multiple hallucinated concepts: 'ENV_MARINE' rating, 'bolted construction' limitations, and 'hygiene requirements for marine environments' â€” none of which appear in the PDF catalog. The multi-stage GDP+GDB assembly suggestion is also unsupported by catalog guidance.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks FZ material for C5-M environment based on corrosion class mismatch (C2 vs C5 needed), but incorrectly implies no catalog solution exists when RF and ZM materials are available for GDB.

strengths: Correctly identifies that FZ (C2 corrosion class) is unsuitable for C5-M marine environments

Fails to recommend viable alternatives: GDB is available in RF (C5) and ZM (C5) materials per the PDF, which would address the C5-M corrosion requirement
Suggests contacting Custom Engineering when standard catalog solutions exist, and proposes an unsupported multi-stage GDP+GDB assembly

content_segments.text: For your offshore platform application, we need to address the environmental stressors. The selected GDB housing with FZ (Galvanized) material is not suitable for marine environments due to the presence of Salt Spray and High Humidity, which accelerate corrosion. Additionally, Outdoor Condensation can form on the housing's surface.
inference_logic: Salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion. C3-rated materials fail prematurely in marine/coastal environments.
Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance (acid-proof stainless).
Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point.
Persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, reducing service life. Consider C4 or C5 materials.

content_segments.text: The GDB housing has a C2 corrosion class and is designed for indoor-only applications. Because of the marine environment, this configuration is BLOCKED. The bolted construction of the GDB housing does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.
inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_MARINE installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for marine environments (ENV_MARINE) and have a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene standards. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

To provide a complete engineering solution, we recommend a multi-stage assembly. This assembly includes a protector stage (GDP) to pre-filter the air and protect the target stage (GDB) from the harsh marine environment. Both stages will share the same dimensions of 600x600mm and handle an airflow of 3,400 mÂ³/h.
To finalize the configuration for the second stage, I need to know the filter depth for the GDB housing.
